description: Single storey detached rear garden outbuilding for use as home office and gym adjacent to existing garage
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: Existing and proposed east elevations - Drawing no. 04 Rev E, Existing and proposed south elevations - Drawing no. 05 Rev F, Existing and proposed west elevations - Drawing no. 06 Rev D, Gym Design Document - Drawing no. 09 Rev 00 and Tree Plan darwing  no.PL010A

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning | All external materials to be used in the development shall be consistent with those listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Development Management DPD (2013), policies D1 and D3 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 1.1 (g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012).	 | The outbuilding shall only be used for domestic purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the dwelling and not for any separate residential, industrial, commercial or business use. No kitchen or cooking facilities shall be installed at any time.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework 2024 - section 12, Council's adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7.4 and 7B, policies 1.1 (g) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies D1 and D6 of the London Plan (2021) and policy DAA of Ealing's Local Plan (Reg.22).
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the submitted Tree Plan drawing number PL010A.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with National Planning Policy and Framework 2024) - section 15, policies G5 and G7 of the London Plan, policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD, Ealing's Local Plan (Reg.22) policy G5 and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines
| The proposed flank window facing the garden of no.103 Brunswick Road shall contain only obscure glass and only have top openings at a minimum of 1.7m from floor level.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with NPPF 2024 - section 12,  policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy DAA of Ealing's local Plan (Reg.22) and policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012)

| Gym equipment, gym flooring and any loudspeakers shall be installed with proprietary anti-vibration mounts or materials and/or be provided with other mitigation measures for the isolation of equipment/floors and loudspeakers from the building structure. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards of the Council's SPG10 and the criteria of BS8233:2014. The isolation of the gym shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise and vibration, in accordance with policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan 2021 policy D13 the National Planning Policy Framework (2024) - section 12 and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'
